content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's the function in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    col = lowercase(col)
    col = strip(col)
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")
    return col
end
```

This function takes a string as input (which represents the column name), and processes it in 4 steps:

1. Lowercase all characters (`lowercase(col)`)
2. Remove leading and trailing whitespaces (`strip(col)`)
3. Replace all spaces with underscores (`replace(col, " " => "_")`)
4. Replace all hyphens with underscores (`replace(col, "-" => "_")`)

The result is then returned as the cleaned column name.
